explanation: Agent A is correct. MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 recommends that a pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever the pointee is not modified. In add_user_headers the local iterator hdr is only used to read fields (hdr->kind, hdr->header_size, hdr->header, hdr->value_size, hdr->value, hdr->next) and the function never modifies the pointed-to structure. Therefore hdr can and should be declared as a pointer to const: e.g. 'const struct MHD_HTTP_Res_Header *hdr;'. This change is type-safe in C because converting from 'struct MHD_HTTP_Res_Header *' (the likely type of hdr->next) to 'const struct MHD_HTTP_Res_Header *' is allowed. (Note: MISRA uses the word "should" for this rule — it is a guideline and deviations can be documented — but the code as written does not follow Rule 8.13.)
